channel.title: Right Click in the wildy (667+)
channel.description: So I'm working on a 667 and for some odd reason, when in the wildy, you have to right click to attack. Now I did some research and was told that it is to do with the team id of the items the person is wearing in the cache. Their 'solution' was to go through every item in the game and set the team id to 0. Does anyone have a better solution to fixing this problem? Much appreciated.

item.title: Right Click in the wildy (667+)
item.dc:creator: @HairyNips HairyNips
item.description:
@HairyNips wrote:

I’ve been searching for a while, can’t seem to find a solution.

Read full topic

item.title: Right Click in the wildy (667+)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You’d want to search in the client where the right click dialogue is displayed…
Or in the server, look for the code that sends the options to the client.

Read full topic

@sk8rdude461 wrote:

So… if the teamId is used literally no where… then how could that possibly be the issue?

item.title: Right Click in the wildy (667+)
item.dc:creator: @HairyNips HairyNips
item.description:
@HairyNips wrote:

This is the only thing I could find. else if (opcode == 115) teamId = stream.readUnsignedByte();

Any ideas? Sorry I’m kinda lost.

Read full topic

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

instead of setting all the team ids to 0, why not find the code that is checking said team id and fixing it there?

So I’m working on a 667 and for some odd reason, when in the wildy, you have to right click to attack. Now I did some research and was told that it is to do with the team id of the items the person is wearing in the cache. Their ‘solution’ was to go through every item in the game and set the team id to 0. Does anyone have a better solution to fixing this problem? Much appreciated.
